The Characters...
The following are the main characters in the story. All of the following characters are friends...

Emily
Emily is a 4'11" 84 lb. blond-haired girl on the junior varsity cheer squad. She is the smallest girl on the team and is a "flyer" (the girl who is tossed up in the air by the larger cheerleaders). The larger, more developed girls on the squad make fun of her short stature and lack of development. She has a sister, Emma, on the varsity cheer squad, who is a pretty 5'4" 115 lb. girl who makes fun of her younger, less developed sister as well. Emily would give almost anything just to cross the 5'0" mark!

Kat
Kat is a 5'0" 90 lb. redhead. Her mom forces her to go to ballet class twice per week, where she is picked on by the other girls. She is clumsy and small and has difficulty executing the moves in dance class. She has acne and braces and is an only child. Her mom puts pressure on her to be elegant, charming, and beautiful, but she feels anything but.

Maria
Maria is a 4'10" 82 lb. Latina girl. She is a point guard on the JV basketball team, but rides the bench most of the time, due to her lack of strength and height. The other girls on the team make fun of her tiny stature and lack of athleticism. Her brother is a year younger but 6 inches taller than her and constantly shows his superiority when they shoot baskets in front of the garage at home as well.

Jessica
Jessica is a 4'9" 78 lb. Asian girl who wears glasses. She is the youngest of three sisters. Her parents love music and want their girls to excel at it. The oldest is about to start college in the fall on a music scholarship. The middle sister is about to start her senior year of high school and is an immensely talented musician. Jessica is in the school choir, but she is small and shy with a squeaky voice. The more beautiful, more developed girls in choir taunt both her looks and her singing ability. Her eldest sister encourages her, but the middle sister belittles her.

The Story Begins...
Two weeks before the school starts, a girl walks into a dusty antique book shop. She sees an ancient-looking Venetian leather-bound book with faded lettering on the cover--

The Burgeoning Book.

When the girl opens the book, it seems to be a collection of short stories about girls who grow larger and more beautiful. A strange sort of glow seems to emanate from the pages as it is opened, and the girl feels a strange tingling sensation as her eyes scan the pages. She closes it and purchases it with all of the cash that she has, then takes it home to read the first story.

Which girl found and purchased the Burgeoning Book?

Some of the girls, like Jamie, Amanda, and Rachel were much taller and bustier than Carly, but Emily would be happy even to match Carly’s 5’1” height and A-cup breasts.

As Emily got to her room, she looked at posters of the most beautiful pop stars and actresses on her wall and sighed enviously. What I wouldn’t do to have even a fraction of their beauty… she thought. She took the book out of her backpack and set it on the desk in her room. If I can’t become more beautiful, at least I can read about girls who do, she thought.

Emily heard her mom’s voice from downstairs and ran down the stairs for dinner. Emily’s 5’4” pretty sister Emma arrived at the table just as she did. Emma used one of her large, sexy hips to bump Emily to the side, sending her sprawling to the ground. “Oops! Sorry about that, squirt! I guess my hips are just getting really wide. “Like you need it, squirt!” said Emma. “What do you weigh… 60 pounds?”

Jamie was more athletic, with a defined stomach under her sports bra, and long legs that brought her to 5’6”. Her chest wasn’t huge, but it was larger than Rachel’s. Amanda, the captain of the squad looked like a model. Long blond hair, D-cup breasts, a slim, leggy 5’8” build, she was what Emily always wished she looked like.

As Emily admired the sexy forms of the other cheerleaders, she felt ashamed as she unzipped her jacket to show her shapeless, tiny body. Carly ran up behind her and knocked her down.

“Sorry—you’re so skinny I didn’t even see you standing there, 2D Emily!” Carly said, with a cruel smile.

“Did you actually lose weight over the summer, 2D? I wouldn’t have thought that possible. You’re boobs look almost concave!” The other girls began to laugh along with Carly.

Emily fumed. God, how she wished her body would just grow!

By the end of the day, Emily had worn out her frail body practicing the cheers, jumps, and throws. She hadn’t even been able to do more than one burpee as the other girls each did thirty. When her mom picked her up and asked how the first day of camp had been, she lied and said that it had been great! Her mom had smiled at her and told her about Emma’s first day of cheer camp when she had been promoted to varsity immediately. Just what I wanted to hear… how another girl is better than me, yet again! thought Emily.

When she got to her room, she shut the door and cried quietly. After a few moments, she looked up and spotted the book she had purchased yesterday. She remembered the stories that she had quickly skimmed in the shop and felt a surge of emotion. She definitely felt like reading a story that might give her some hope! Kat opened the book and the golden glow illuminated her face. Her eyes skimmed the pages and she flipped toward the end of the book until a title caught her eye.

Emily and the Cheer Squad

Emily watched her friend’s jaw drop, then walked around to see what Kat was looking at in the book. She read the title and the opening paragraph of the unfinished story, and gasped, “Oh my God…”

The two friends read the story about Emily, Carly, Jamie, Rachel, Amanda, and Emma. At the bottom, they read about Emily and Kat and the measurements, the final words appearing on the page as they read them. There was no doubt. The book was recording Emily’s own story as it went!

Little did the girls know as they looked at each other in stunned silence, they had both gained another inch in the time that it took them to read Emily’s story.

“Good, good,” he said. “Wizards sometimes choose to have their magical remains crafted into a magical artifact, so that their magic is not lost forever.”

“Okay, okay. How much will it cost for you to make the new artifact?” Emily asked.

“It will cost you nothing except one day with the artifact’s magic for myself,” the man stated.

“Hmph,” her Mom muttered. “Well next time call and let me know before I send out the search party!” Kat nodded and apologised again.

She was surprised that there didn’t seem to be a punishment coming. Maybe her Mom had actually been impressed when she’d mentioned the sorbet, as if she was pleased her daughter was starting to think about ladylike things for herself without being forced. The search party comment also made her realise that her Mom did actually care and was actually worried about her and she felt a little ashamed about making the whole thing up. Still, it was only her Mom’s overbearing strictness that made lying to her necessary in the first place.
“I won’t do it again, but I’ve got homework so I’ll be upstairs ‘til dinner,” and grabbing her bag the small girl dashed up to her room before any further interrogation could take place. Once there, door closed for what privacy she could get, Kat removed her prize from her bag and laid it on her desk.

The Burgeoning Book

She ran her fingertips over the gold embossed lettering on the leather cover and read the words out loud to herself. Opening the cover there was no author’s note, no contents page, no index or anything, only a title and a short story every few pages. There were so many to choose from she didn’t know where to start.
12.title: Trials and tribulations of a lady-in-the-making

121.content:
Kat slowly turned the heavy old pages and skimmed over the titles. She’d noticed that all of the stories seemed to refer to some part of the female body, and only one. From what she could tell at a glance, each was about a girl whose body began to change in just that one aspect. Each was a few pages long and she probably only had enough time to read one before dinner, after which she really would need to get on with her homework for tomorrow. One particular title caught her eye.

Lucy’s Luxurious Locks

Kat had been a flaming redhead all her life and had mixed feelings about her hair. On the one hand it was bright and wild and she felt it gave her otherwise small and unimpressive form some character. On the other hand it was frizzy, tangled and difficult to manage and never seemed to look the way she wanted. Intrigued, she began to read.

Lucy was a lovely lass from a little village by the Long Lake. Lucy loved to lie languidly by the lake and look at the long white clouds littering the sky. Lately, Lucy had looked longingly at the local Lord’s son, Liam, loving him from afar. Lonely and languishing, she listened to the lore of the local wisewoman, Lady Lyra...

The story went on to describe Lucy’s plan to attract the attention of young lord Liam using a potion brewed by Lady Lyra. The potion gave Lucy the most beautiful locks in all the land which grew longer and lovelier until eventually Lucy and her locks caught Liam’s eye and the pair lived happily ever after.

The wording was archaic and a bit difficult to follow in places, but eventually Kat finished the story and closed the heavy tome with a thud. She pulled a lock of her own hair in front of her eyes and stared at it, wishing she could attract her dream boy by the beauty of her hair alone. It was a nice story, but not something that could ever really happen. Girl is plain and lonely, girl uses magic thingamajig, girl becomes beautiful and achieves all her dreams. As if.

“Kat, dinner time!” Came her Mom’s voice from downstairs. Tucking her new favourite book out of sight under some papers in the top drawer of her desk, Kat called back in response and headed down to eat.

***


It wasn’t until her morning routine the next day that Kat noticed the difference. While she’d been studying the night before she had tucked her hair behind her ears and out of the way, but it still kept falling into her eyes somehow. It was only when she took her morning shower and washed it that it became obvious that her very own lovely locks were about 3 inches longer than they should be. Drying off, she noticed they were also a bit nicer than before. Nothing spectacular, but maybe a bit shinier and smoother than normal.

It was completely impossible, but very welcome all the same. Kat felt like she should be freaking out more, as though magic being real and apparently contained within an old book she’d bought at the mall should be more of a world-shattering revelation. Something was keeping her calm though, probably the same thing that had kept her from worrying about buying the book on impulse the day before. Something was suppressing her concerns just enough that she noticed the change but didn’t go to pieces over it. Kat didn’t like the feeling that her mind was being messed with, but it didn’t bother her all that much, which she realised was probably part of the effect as well. There was nothing much she could do though, and she did like her improved hair, so she just went on with her day.

“Your hair looks nice today dear,” was all she got from her Mom over breakfast. Again, noticing a change but not really bothered by it. Maybe the magic worked on everyone, not just her. The same was true at school. Kat had a pretty normal day, caught up with her friends, was bored by some classes, frustrated by others and terrified by a sudden pop quiz in one. She got an unreasonable pile of homework and wandered slowly home at the end of the day where the Burgeoning Book was waiting safely in her top drawer.

At that point Kat noticed she had changed again. Her hair was shinier, thicker and another 3 inches longer than it had been that morning, having gone from shoulder length to reaching her shoulderblades in 24 hours. It would have reached her bra strap, she thought ruefully, if only she needed to wear a bra. The book was doing this to her, it was clear. She had no idea how it was possible, beyond the obvious answer of ‘it’s a magic book’, but there was no other explanation. She bought a weird book from a strange store that she’d never seen before, read a story about a girl magically growing long, beautiful hair and overnight she grew longer, more beautiful hair. Even without knowing the mechanics, it didn’t take a genius to figure out the trigger.

So Kat looked with interest at the other stories in the book, flipping through the pages until she found one she couldn’t pass up.
121.title: Lucy’s Luxurious Locks

1211.content:
Kat's darting eyes locked onto a single word on the page as she flipped idly through the book. Taller. It called out to her. It brought to mind memories of always being the shortest girl in her class, of hoping she would grow just a little bit more. She did grow, but others always grew more. Kat was always behind the curve and always looking up. As a little girl she dreamt of puberty when she would grow more and faster than ever and get some curves of her own. It didn't happen. Puberty came sure enough and she was delighted to finally reach 5 feet tall, an adult height at last, but that was all she got. Her ideal height was 5'9", taller than most girls, tall enough that her form would look more slender and elegant but not so tall that guys would hesitate to ask her out.

She knew tall girls had a tougher time finding dates and people always thought a couple looked odd if the girl was taller than the guy. The young Kat reasoned that nobody would notice a 1 inch difference so at 5'9" she could date guys who were 5'8" and above. If she could find a really tall guy, 6' or taller, then she could even wear heels and she wouldn't look like a shrimp standing next to her man. Kat giggled at the memory of some couples she had seen where the guy was well over 6 feet and the girl was closer to 5. She imagined just stealing a kiss must involve either a great deal of bending or possibly some lifting on his part. No risk of that with the perfect 5'9" girl! Which of course, she was not...

...but perhaps with the help of her new favourite book, she could be! Kat pulled a lock of flame red hair before her eyes again and momentarily smiled at its improvement. If the book could do for her height what it was doing for her hair then anything was possible. The hopeful little smile still on her face, she took up the book and began to read.

Tara was told the tale of Tiny Tim by a travelling teller. Tiny Tim was a titchy tot who never grew any taller. Terribly for her, Tiny Tim's tale was Tara's truth. To Tara though, the travelling teller told another tale. To the tippy top of the tallest oak tree must she climb tonight...

The story continued with Tara learning of the full moon's blessing on a single acorn at the very top of the biggest tree in the forest. That acorn was destined to be the tallest tree in the future, but if she plucked it under the full moon then some of it's power would flow into her. Tara found the tree and plucked the acorn and wore it around her neck like a charm. Little by little she grew taller and taller until she was the tallest girl in the village and nobody ever looked down on her again.

Kat closed the Burgeoning Book and laid a hand gently on its cover. She really hoped it would work its magic on her again. Lucky for her she didn't need to go climbing tall trees in the middle of the night, that sounded dangerous! With any luck she could get the same results as Tara just by reading the other girl's story. Knowing she wasn't going to get immediate results though, Kat put the book aside and somehow managed to focus on her homework for the rest of the evening until it was time for bed. Well, mostly focus on her homework. She did idly have one hand on her measuring tape from time to time while she worked. It wouldn't be needed until the morning, but just running her fingers over it was a happy reminder that she might not be the shortest girl in class from now on.

***


Normally, Kat was a slow riser, she pressed the snooze button several times and only really hauled herself out of bed when her Mom came knocking on her door threatening to drag her out if necessary. That morning though, as soon as her foggy mind could comprehend that she was awake her eyes snapped open and she threw off the blankets in a rush. The tape measure was in her hand a she had her back to the wall with a pencil held overhead in the blink of an eye. At that point she slowed right down though so as to be completely accurate and very carefully drew a faint line on the wall behind her. Once she had made her mark, she stepped forward and with shaking hands measured up from the floor.

Technically, the measurement was 5'0" but the brilliant smile broadening slowly on Kat's face told a different story. One eighth of an inch. She was one eighth of an inch taller. You couldn't see it by looking at her and you could barely tell on the tape measure, but Kat had hoped so desperately to be taller that she had measured herself hundreds of times, not wanting to believe that she had stopped growing at only 5 feet. She knew exactly how tall she was down to the smallest fraction and now the smallest fraction had been added. As if to mock the miniscule growth in her height, Kat's lovely locks were another full 3 inches longer and much less frizzy than before but she hardly noticed after the revelation of her newest change.

She spent the entire school day giddy with excitement but refused to tell anyone who asked why she was so happy. 'A magic book is making me taller! You can't tell but it's definitely happening,' were the words of a crazy person and Kat retained enough good sense not to speak them. Even so, she breezed through the day with nothing able to bring her down and measured herself again as soon as she got home. Another eighth of an inch. Two more of those and she'd be half an inch taller. That was when you could round up! She started doing the math and then stopped suddenly, a frown forming for the first time that day.

Kat had done these calculations before. When she was still growing she'd worked out how long it would take to get to 5'9" at her current rate. Then it had stopped and her hopes had been dashed. She wouldn't make that mistake this time. She would measure herself from time to time and be glad of every fraction of an inch but she wouldn't have expectations. All that mattered was that she was growing again and she had the book to thank for it. That brought it to the front of her mind again and seconds later it was out of the drawer and in her hands again. The Burgeoning Book had done so much for her already, but she couldn't help wonder if it would keep blessing her with growth if she just kept reading its stories.

Next up for Kat was...

12112.content:
Veronica's Virtuous Voice

Kat looked at the title and wondered if she should tell Jess about it. Her friend was always complaining about her squeaky, immature voice. Kat’s eyes scanned the page as she considered. Maybe she should test it out first, to see what it would do before she shared it with her friend…

Veronica was in the vicinity of a visitor to the villa, the very vivacious vocalist Verity. The velvet voice of the visibly voluminous vacationer was vivid and virtuous. Unfortunately, the vain woman vexed Veronica, viciously vehement and vociferous in her vile and venomous views…

When Kat finished, she spoke a few words. Was there anything different about her voice? She couldn’t tell. It might be ever so slightly richer… but maybe that was just her imagination. Her changes in height were very subtle at this point--maybe it would be similar with her voice.

She didn’t have time to experiment any further right now, with ballet in twenty minutes. Kat quickly changed into her leotard, grabbed her ballet shoes and ran downstairs. Her mom was already holding her coat out for her.

“Sorry, Mom, I was busy reading, and I lost track of time…” said Kat sheepishly.

“I swear, dear, if I had a nickel for every time you were running late, I would already have your college fund taken care of,” said her Mom, looking at her with an ostensibly stern expression. Kat could see the fondness in her eyes, though. As Kat grabbed the door to head out to the car, her mother ran her fingers through her long, thick hair, fluffing it a bit.

“You really are blessed with this magnificent head of hair. I’m so glad that you take such good care of it. It looks so vibrant and healthy,” said her mother.

“Thanks, mom!” said Kat. It was rare for her mom to compliment her appearance this way, and she was basking in the feeling as she hopped into the car.

Unfortunately, as she arrived at ballet class, the girls in ballet were less complimentary.

“Hey, look! It’s the redheaded stepchild of the class!”

“Hey, Kat, your head’s on fire! Oh, wait… that’s just your hair!”

Kat ignored the other girls’ barbs as she always did, putting on her shoes, then lining up for barre.

Class proceeded uneventfully until the girls reached the Allégro movement, and they needed to practice fast feet and jumps. Kat stumbled out of the landing and landed hard on her back, the air whooshing out of her as she hit. Long, full, vividly red curls spilled across the hardwood floor. Kat felt color begin to rise from her neck as titters of laughter erupted around her from the other girls.

Vanessa, the worst of them all, was quick to comment.

“I knew that ridiculous mass of hair of yours was good for something! Let me get a bucket of water--this place could use a good mopping.”

Kat’s warm, pleasant feeling from her mother’s compliment before class made the harsh pain of Vanessa’s ridicule all the worse this time, as the crimson patches that colored her cheeks deepened a shade.

Kat rose to her feet and excused herself from class as her teacher glared at Vanessa for her rude comment. She ran to the bathroom, closed the stall door, closed the lid of the toilet, curled her feet up to her chest and began to cry.

Just when she was feeling better about herself, her classmates, especially Vanessa, had to go and ruin it for her. Why couldn’t they just let her have this one day to feel good?

Kat let her tears finish, then wiped them away with her fingers. She took a moment before the mirror to compose herself, then steeled her courage to go through with the rest of class.

That evening, as she ate dinner across from her mother in silence, her mother finally spoke.

“My goodness, Kat! Why are you so glum this evening? You haven’t said two words to me since I drove you home from ballet!”

“I just didn’t have a very good class today. That’s all,” said Kat.

“Well, you know how I feel about you taking ballet, dear. Ballet gives you grace and elegance. Every woman should have those qualities, you know. Of course, you could take choir as well. When you were singing along to the radio, I noticed that your singing voice is rather pleasant.”
“It is?” said Kat, shocked.

Her attention now on it, she did notice a dulcet undertone within her speaking voice that she was reasonably certain hadn’t been there before.

Her Mom gave her a puzzled look as Kat smiled broadly, her gloomy mood evaporated by her sudden realization of another book-given gift.

***

That night, Kat lay in bed, staring at the ceiling. She should be sleeping, but she couldn’t. The events from ballet, the changes to her hair, her height, and her voice, combined to keep her thoughts whirring deep into the night.

Finally, she reached a hand out to turn on her lamp. Her eyes slipped to the book on her nightstand. She gave into temptation and cracked open the large tome just below her underdeveloped chest, idly flipping through the pages as she lay in bed.

Another story caught her eye.
12112.title: Veronica's Virtuous Voice

121123.content:
The fact that she could see the very bottom line of every story in the large book across the entirely flat expanse of her non-existent chest was not lost on Kat. She was pleased with everything the Burgeoning Book had given her so far, very pleased, but she still wasn't going to be winning any beauty contests any time soon.

If there was one thing which had bothered her as much if not more than being short it was being flat. Breasts were something she had never had, not even a little. She may not have grown up very tall, but at least she had grown a bit. In the chest department Kat was a complete non-starter. She had no idea what it was like for other girls to look down and see actual curves, let alone not be able to see their feet. As the title of the next story burned itself into her brain, the redheaded teen wondered what it would be like to finally feel like a woman for the first time in her life.

Chelsea was a charming creature, cute and carefree as can be. Conversely, her closest companion Caroline was cunning and competitive. The couple of them were constantly combing the countryside by carriage and by cart for clothes and cuisine but Caroline conspired to curb Chelsea's choices by claiming the choicest for herself. When Chelsea...

The story became something of a tragedy after Chelsea began growing the most 'charming chest' with the most 'cavernous cleavage' in all the land and Caroline was completely outclassed in her one-sided rivalry for eligible suitors but still did everything she could to ruin Chelsea's life.

Closing the book, Kat knew she didn't have to worry about that. What had happened at ballet earlier was not exactly an isolated incident. She was already suffering from other girls trying to ruin her life, or at least taking great pleasure in laughing at her every misfortune. Kat would kill for a big enough bust to drive them mad with jealousy. She could get her own back on them without lifting a finger and there wouldn't be a thing they could do about it.

Looking down at the straight and uninterrupted fall of her nightshirt for what she hoped was the last time, Kat fluffed her now even thicker mass of vibrant red hair out over her pillow and closed her eyes, looking forward to what the morning would bring.

***


Having stayed up so late reading the previous night, Kat had no time in the morning to measure anything and could only hope she was still growing taller. In her rush to get out the door on time though, she could have sworn her chest was the slightest bit more prominent than before. Without the book in her life she would have brushed it off as a trick of the light but her gorgeous new mane and the fact that even her idle humming was somehow in tune now made it clear she wasn't seeing things. It had started and who knew when it would stop.

The downtrodden but defiant core inside of Kat secretly hoped her breasts would keep growing until she overshadowed not just the girls who tormented her but their friends, their sisters, their mothers and every woman in their lives until she was without question the bustiest, curviest, most feminine girl any of them had ever seen and completely beyond any hope of catching up. That was how she wanted to avenge all of the barbs and insults she had suffered. Not by bullying them in return or spreading rumors but by total, crushing victory in the puberty war.

Kat may have been at the very bottom of the hierarchy, but she knew how the system worked. Extreme hotness was a completely unassailable defensive position as well as the insignia of commanding rank. Any attempt by a less attractive girl to bully or even sass a hotter one was entirely ineffective and just looked jealous and pathetic to those observing. As the underdog it was very frustrating since there was no way at all to turn the tables, but Kat now had a secret weapon and her campaign was underway. She wasn't going to see Vanessa or the other ballet girls for a few days and that gave her strategy, and herself, time to develop.

For now though, she had school and a whole different set of torments to endure, starting with how her best friend could possibly be this lively this early in the morning.
"It's so not fair. Not even a little bit. How do you do that? You look like you've barely slept, your eyes are all puffy, your skin is even paler than usual and yet somehow you're always having a good hair day!" Jess grumbled in exasperation as Kat met her at the lockers. Drawing the flaming waterfall in front of her protectively in case Jess decided to take out her frustration on it, Kat noticed it was longer still and its weight had pulled it into soft waves leaving just the ends to curl and bounce behind her.
"I don't know, it's just like that. I don't really do anything to it," she replied meekly.
"That's even worse! It's like you're mocking me and every other girl with just how naturally amazing your hair is with no effort at all. How dare you!" the Asian girl exclaimed, wearing a strict expression and waggling an accusatory finger under Kat's nose before breaking into giggles. Kat giggled softly too before clapping a hand across her mouth at the unexpectedly musical sound. There was no way to measure it, but from time to time she noticed the small improvements in her voice since the previous day.

"She does have nice hair, doesn't she?" A new voice drawled sarcastically from behind them. The pair turned to find their school's head cheerleader and queen bitch Angelica, looking down on them. "I'd ask how she does it, but of course I don't take advice from ugly flat-chested midgets, so once you sort the rest of ...this out you be sure to come and see me." The taller girl waved an imperious hand up and down to indicate the whole of Kat's body before her laughter became the cue for the sycophants around her to join in. Until recently, Kat would have turned as red as her hair and run from the cruel laughter but now there was a spark inside her and it was growing as she did.
"I will," she replied quietly, the clarity of her enhanced voice making sure everyone heard her despite the noise of laughter. "Just remember you said that because I will come for you, when I'm ready." Kat stared straight up into Angelica's eyes. The implied threat was weakened a bit because Kat's nose barely cleared the taller girl's impressive chest which strained against a cheerleading top probably a size too small and wobbled with her laughter. However, the intensity of her gaze seemed to unnerve Angelica and the laughter petered out into awkward silence while Kat held her stare for a long moment before grabbing Jess's arm and marching out of the circle of taller, more developed students. Nobody tried to stop them, everyone was too shocked.

Kat kept up the strong front until they turned a corner out of sight before leaning against a wall and sagging as the tension left her.
"What was that?" Jess whispered in quiet awe, still processing recent events.
"Can't let her win every time," Kat replied, sounding tired. "Maybe Angelica's got it all over me. Maybe I am ugly, short and flat compared to her but that might not always be true and maybe next time she'll think twice." Jess just looked at her friend in silence before grabbing her hand.
"Come on then, we've got to get to class."

Kat allowed herself to be led, still thinking about Angelica's taunts. She wouldn't be short or flat for much longer if the book kept doing its thing and maybe once she got home there was something she could do about ugly as well.

There were plenty more stories to read. Next up would be:
121123.title: Kat reads Chelsea's Charming Chest

1211231.content:
Kat flipped through the book searching for a story that best fit her current desire. Remembering Jess’ comments on her pasty face and puffy eyes as well as Angelica’s nastiness of the day--despite her best efforts to forget the latter--Kat wanted something that would help her turn the ugly duckling reflected in her mirror every morning into a beautiful swan. Flipping another set of pages, a smile burst forth on her thin lips. She saw the title of the perfect story for the task.

Fiona's Flawless Face

Her eyes began to flow along the words.

Fiona felt the fanfare was a farce. A flawless face? What a funny fantasy that flirtatious, fickle fop of a friar had floated forth. Finding herself furtively filled with foolish fulfillment at fetching the fevering friar’s fervent fancy, she finally, fondly, found the fascinating foundation of facts that forced the flow of freakish fate to finish with the fantastic formation of the fair, feminine, features of her famously faultless face ‘ere they faded forth to their former fog of forgetfulness.

Fiona frollicked with her furry friends in the fertile forest that fine Friday…

As she finished the fine fable, Kat’s body, exhausted, perhaps, from its growth over the course of the day, sent her into a deep, unbroken sleep.

Kat woke up the following morning feeling incredibly energized. As her brain kicked into gear, she could think of nothing save the changes the book may have wrought on her flourishing figure overnight. She flung off the sheets and bounded out of bed, coming to a stop before the mirror in her room, eyes exploring her appearance with an intense gaze.

Her hair had gained another three inches in length during the night, its thick, vivid tresses forming ginger ringlets that cascaded in a massive, shifting wave over her shoulders and down her back. As it caught the light with shimmering undulations from her movements, Kat thought that the girl from ballet, though she hadn’t meant her comment as a compliment, wasn’t entirely wrong. Her hair did look a bit like fire--liquid fire--flickering and licking her improving form as it poured over her developing curves. Her hair was beginning to feel a bit heavy for her slender neck to hold upright--at some point, she would need to have it cut. As she admired it’s full, rich expanse, however, she decided that it would be a shame to lose any part of this sumptuous treasure.

Kat had never really felt attractive and, well, womanly before, but the stunning splendor of her magnificent mane gave her a sense of pride in her appearance, foreign to her until now.

With effort, she finally tore her eyes away from her ginger locks to see if there had been changes to her face. There were.

Her face hadn’t undergone massive changes, only slight ones. Her cheekbones looked slightly more pronounced, her lips had swelled a bit, and her eyes looked marginally larger and brighter. Her eyebrows seemed to take on a higher, more refined arch. Her nose seemed slightly smaller, the tip more retroussé in shape.

Kat glanced to her chest, which was noticeably fuller. It must have increased a full cup size! Maybe she was a full 28A now! While still small, the lemon-sized evidence of femininity that graced her upper torso made her giddy with excitement! For the first time in her young life, she was beginning to look like a woman!

She ran over to find her tape measure and stepped onto the bottom, running it up her back, then pinching it off at the top of her head. She turned to see what it read. 5’1”!!!

“I’m finally a full inch taller!” she said aloud, thoughts jumping from enthusiasm for her new height to note a clear difference in her voice. Even with only the one short, softly spoken phrase, she could tell that it was taking on a mellifluous tone, feminine and pleasing to the ear.

She couldn’t wait to see Jess’ reaction to her accumulating improvements! Her body was far from a match for Angelica’s, but it was closing the gap. And her hair! It was a match for the models in magazines already! She giggled as she thought of the prospect of modeling for hair ads. Such a thing would have been absurd just days ago, but now…

Kat felt like dressing up for school today. Eschewing her typical jeans and t-shirt, she instead put on a white dress that complemented her increasingly healthy-looking skin and showed the small but growing swells on her chest. She donned white crystal earrings and white wedges to match.

Kat looked in the mirror, pleased, overall, with her enhanced figure, but still giving a critical eye to her shapeless waist, two-dimensional hips and butt, and her sticklike legs. She looked at the clock and considered. She could probably squeeze in one more story before she needed to head downstairs for breakfast.

She carried the book over to her desk from her nightstand and flipped it open. The title of the story at appeared was....

12112313.content:
Lily's Long, Luscious Legs

Luckless Lily landed like a lump on the level landing. Her little, lethargic, languishing legs labored to lift the lithe lass under the leering, lamp-lit looks of the lord of the land. Lily’s lips lolled as she listened to the lovely largo lilt of the lyrical lady. At long last, Lily lifted a leg and launched a lovely leap...

Kat licked her lips as she lingered on the story’s final words, looking forward to the effect she knew it would have on her legs. If her slender legs could put on some shapely, toned, muscle, maybe they would actually begin to resemble those of an actual ballerina. She wouldn’t have to worry about falling out her leaps during ballet class then!

She heard a knock at her door, followed by her mother’s voice.

“Kat! Wake up! You need to get ready for school!”

She opened the door, and watched her mother’s eyes widen in surprise as the older woman took in her appearance.

“Well, I’m glad you’re already up and dressed! My goodness, I forgot just how wonderful your hair is looking these days, Kitty Kat. That dress really brings out the… fullness of your figure as well. Just remember not to eat all those carbs they have in the school lunches, dear. You don’t want to add any pounds to that slender profile of yours.” Her mother’s eyes narrowed slightly at the word “fullness,” but the look quickly faded as she continued.

Kat grinned. Her mother had given her usual chiding remarks on her figure, but clearly, she was noticing Kat’s developing beauty. She couldn’t suppress a giggle as she thought of what her mom’s reaction might be a week from now..

Her mom shot a curious glance to her daughter as the melodic laugh escaped the girl’s slightly fuller lips, then shook her head. Teenagers--you could never understand what they are thinking!

Kat shoveled some breakfast down, then gulped her juice before bounding out the door, clearly eager to go to school. Her mother’s lips curled upward at her daughter’s unusual level of excitement this morning. She was glad that her daughter was happy, even if she wasn’t behaving particularly ladylike. As her daughter closed the door behind her, she put the girl’s dishes into the dishwasher.

***

Jessica marveled over Kat’s hair when her friend approached her in the hall.

“How is it that you only have good hair days… and better hair days, while the rest of us are stuck with this!” Jessica ran her fingers through the thin, dull, lifeless black strands atop her small head until they hit a tangle. She pulled her tiny hands away from her head with a frustrated growl.

Kat strongly considered telling her friend about the book, but she resisted the urge for the moment. Just a few more days before she shared her little secret with the petite Asian girl. She relished being the center of increasingly positive attention and didn’t want to share the spotlight just yet. There would be plenty of time to help her friend, after all, once Kat was a bit further along in her growth.

“Your complexion looks clearer too! Okay, spill! Makeup? Conditioner? One of those fancy shampoos? What little tip can you give your lifelong bestie to help her out, eh?”

Kat pulled a book from her locker for first period then turned to her friend.

“Um, just the usual, you know,” said Kat, feeling a tinge of guilt at hiding the book from her friend. Maybe she should just tell her now rather than waiting…

As Jessica’s face dropped in obvious disappointment, Kat opened her mouth to give her the lowdown on The Burgeoning Book. Before she could say anything, however, she heard Angelica’s voice from behind her.

“I’m glad you were able to find some clothes in the toddler section, Jessica. It’s too bad they don’t make women’s clothes for those that are shaped like prepubescent boys.”

The sycophant squad behind Angelica snickered, casting wicked stares toward Jessica’s rapidly falling eyes until her gaze fell squarely on the floor, crimson circles blooming on the tiny girl’s cheeks.

Strangely, didn’t say anything to Kat as her eyes quickly scanned her inch-taller form. Kat thought she detected a flicker of uncertainty in the voluptuous girl’s eyes, but it was gone before she could be sure--if it had actually been there at all.

Belatedly, Kat called out to the flock of departing girls.

“She’s not that small!”

Wait! That didn’t sound like the clever, fiery comeback she had intended to hurl at the girls! They didn’t even acknowledge her pathetic attempt at retribution, continuing to walk in the opposite direction.

Kat turned her gaze back to Jessica, who had already turned and was running away to the women’s restroom, likely to cry.

Kat sighed and felt a spark of anger at the cocky head of the cheer team. She was going to bring that horrible girl down from her perch on the top of the school’s social ladder, no matter how much time--or how many stories--it took.

As she watched her friend jog to the bathroom, head bowed, books clutched to her miniscule chest, she made another silent vow as well. She would show Jessica the book tonight. She wasn’t going to wait any longer. Now that Angelica’s bullying ways seemed to have turned their focus to Jess, she needed to come to her friend’s rescue.

***

“So why did you want me to come over tonight?” asked Jess, eyeing her friend, who had seemed to grow a bit prettier over the course of the day, even as her makeup wore off. Come to think of it, Kat looked a bit taller too. Were her legs longer?

“To show you this!” said Kat in a velvet voice, a mischievous look on her now-cute features. She swung the book upward from the desk, an excited look in her eyes.

Jessica gave her friend a disbelieving--and slightly bored--look, clearly less than impressed.

“Okaaaaay. I’m glad you have a new… er, old, weird book, but I’ve got homework to do, and my mom will want me to be home in time for dinner, and…” Jessica trailed off, clearly not thrilled about reading some centuries-old book and looking for an excuse to leave.

Before Kat could speak, Jessica turned toward the door.

Kat…
12112313.title: Lily's Long, Luscious Legs

Focus on Vanessa and the mean girls at ballet practice
121123132.content:
As Jessica turned to leave Kat's hand came up almost involuntarily, reaching for her friend to make her stay. Kat wanted to share the book with Jess, wanted to share its powers and let her friend have the same benefits that she was experiencing. That was the good friend in her, wanting the best for the people she cared about.

Another voice in Kat's head disagreed though. The compassionate side of her wanted to help her friend right away, but the dispassionate side advised her to wait. Cold logic told her she still knew almost nothing about the book or its powers and she could do a lot of harm in her ignorance. She'd been lucky so far. Apparently magic was real and it was making her beautiful but how did it work? She really had no idea.

What if it wasn't just reading the stories but also sleeping in the same room as the book that was making her grow? She'd have to take it to school and lend it to Jess overnight. It wouldn't be safe. It would be in her locker where Angelica or some other bully could steal it. What if Jess got addicted to its power and never gave it back?

What if the book only recognised one owner at a time and as long as it was changing Kat it wouldn't work for Jess? It would seem like a cruel trick to Jess. Kat would 'reveal' the source of all of her wonderful improvements and give Jess hope that she could change too only to crush that hope immediately when it didn't work. She would think Kat was naturally blessed and making up nonsense just to make fun of her.

Or worse still, what if as soon as Jess read a story from it the book's power transferred to her and all of Kat's changes stopped? Then she could only watch Jess growing taller, bustier and more beautiful every day while she stayed as she was right now suffering with the knowledge that she'd had everything she'd ever wanted and foolishly lost it forever.

On top of all of that, even if it did work for Jess the way she hoped it would look pretty suspicious to anyone at school. Kat was short, plain, flat and generally unattractive and all of a sudden she starts the world's greatest growth spurt and only a few days later her equally unattractive best friend also begins developing into a stunning beauty. No one would buy that as a coincidence. One girl growing up nicely was good genetics but hotness wasn't transferable through the bonds of friendship. Anyone who noticed both of them changing would come looking for the source. Kat knew there was some kind of mind-affecting power that suppressed concerns over the book's changes but it had to have its limits.

That was another thing, both her mother and Jess and even Vanessa had commented on some of Kat's enhancements over the past few days so she knew they were seeing her as she was, but neither seemed to think anything was strange, so perhaps they didn't remember her as she used to be. What if she didn't notice Jess' changes? What if she lent Jess the book and then couldn't see anything different about her? Or worse, what if she lent Jess the book and its power to make others accept its changes made Kat forget about the book itself altogether?

All of these thoughts and worries swirled around Kat's mind in the few seconds it took Jess to cross her room to the door where she stopped and turned around.
"Oh, uh sure. I thought maybe reading a story together would help cheer you up. Some other time then." Kat mumbled, lowering her hand. She gave her friend a little smile of encouragement which turned up the corners of Jess' mouth if nothing else.
"Yeah, thanks, another time," Jessica replied and left the room with a wave of her hand.

Kat turned back to the book on her desk. She had wanted to share the book's power with Jess to protect her from the bullies too, but if she couldn't do that then Kat would have to protect her friend herself. Defying Angelica had seemed to work at least a little when she'd stood up to her earlier but she'd only switched targets to Jess. That only meant Kat had to make it clear that Jess was off limits too.

There was another rule of social warfare that could help her with that. Hot girls were allowed to have less attractive friends and they formed cliques around themselves. The leader of one clique didn't pick on the followers in another clique. It was like admitting they couldn't win against the leader of the rival group and had to go for an easier target. If Kat could make it clear to Angelica that Jess was with her then Angelica would have to stop picking on Jess and focus all of her attention on Kat or she would lose face.

Kat could hardly believe she was about to bring down even more heat from the queen of the school onto herself but if she couldn't directly help her best friend with the book then she would have to do it indirectly. Kat's own defence against Angelica would be her ever-improving face and figure and eventually she hoped she would equal and then beat the hottest girl in school at her own game.

With that in mind, Kat picked up the book again and chose the next story.

Rebecca's Resplendent Rear

Rebecca rarely reveled in the regal rondure of her resplendent rear. She was really rather reticent and regularly relaxed reflectively as a relative recluse. Rumours roamed though, and one day a royal retainer rang the bell at her residence...

The story described the prince having dispatched servants to every village seeking to track down the girl with the finest rear end in all the land, summoning them to the castle for a ball, Cinderella style.

Kat ran a hand over her flat backside and wondered what it was like to have a proper popping bubble butt. Hopefully she would soon find out but even as quick as the book seemed to work its magic nothing was going to happen straight away. Her talk with Jess, brief as it had been, was emotionally draining and after a quiet dinner with her Mom she went almost straight to sleep.

***


Mornings were quickly becoming Kat's favorite part of the day because they always brought the biggest changes. She couldn't tell if it was because the time she was asleep made hours of changes seem to appear immediately or whether being asleep let her body focus on growing and she actually did change more overnight but either way the results were obvious.

Maybe because her legs were now lengthening alongside her height itself, Kat discovered she was a full half inch taller than before, meaning her growth rate had effectively doubled. The excitement at the thought she might reach her ideal height even faster now made her do a little dance which only served to highlight a few more things.

Her magnificent hair, now almost down to her waist and so thick she could lose an arm in it flew out in a wave of shimmering fiery curls as she spun. Her legs seemed to be a little more toned but as a ballerina-in-training she also noticed feeling slightly more balanced and graceful. This was good as for the very first time in her life there was a weight on her chest which affected her center of gravity and didn't entirely stop moving when she did. Bringing her hands up to cup the perky little breasts which projected from her chest in an unfamiliar but extremely pleasant way, Kat grinned broadly and willed the tiny mounds to grow into giant mountains to put the small hills of all of her rivals to shame.

The mirror showed improved facial features, still recognisably hers but more refined. Eyes brighter and wider, nose smaller and slimmer, skin smoother, cheekbones higher, teeth more straight and lips more plump. Alone each trait had barely changed but put together they made Kat a noticeably prettier girl than even just yesterday. Finally she ran questing hands around her hips and over her flat backside and for once there was something pushing them outwards. It was barely there, but there was cushioning flesh where there had been none before. The book was doing its work and Kat couldn't suppress a giggle of delight which rang out across her room clear as a bell.

It was time for school and there was only one thing on Kat's mind besides her changes. How was she going to deal with Angelica?

1211231321.content:
When Kat reached sight of her locker, she found Angelica again preying on her friend, the tiger toying with an unfortunate, fearful rabbit.

“... annoying us all with your pathetic runt body and your disgusting little face!” Kat heard Angelica finish. She saw Jess flinch under the caustic weight of every syllable, the beautiful girl’s ugly words shredding her friend’s already meager self confidence.

Righteous fury erupted inside of Kat, her fingers quivering and clenching with anger. How dare Angelica do this to her friend! Kat was going to put a stop to this right now! She needed to protect Jess. Kat would ensure that she was only one of her circle of friends that Angelica would be confronting from now on.

Fiery rage stoking her bravery, Kat walked right up to Angelica and slapped her across the face. Hard.

Angelica looked stunned, as did her circle of sycophants. Kat gulped, a bit shocked at her own actions, but she forced down the momentary uncertainty and looked Angelica squarely in the eye, summoning her fury-fed courage once again.

“Angelica, I knew you were a bitch, but this is low even for you! If you have a problem with one of my friends, you take it up with me from now on.”

Angelica, caught completely off guard by the smaller girl’s boldness, hesitated, her hand slowly rising to touch her burning cheek. Angelica had not anticipated this turn of events in her wildest imagination. None of her victims had ever fought back like this before. Most of them never fought back at all.

Before Angelica could gather herself sufficiently to respond, Kat grabbed her wide-eyed friend’s hand and pulled Jess away.

“Come on, Jess. Let’s get to class.”

As they walked away, Angelica stared daggers into Kat’s back.

***

When the two friends sat down at their desks in first period, Jess turned to Kat and whispered.

“Oh my goodness, Kat! What has gotten into you?!”

Kat, the vestiges of her anger having faded on their walk to the classroom, was feeling slightly queasy now. She shrugged, not knowing what to say.

“Angelica is going to be out for blood now, you know!” said Jess, her brows furrowing in concern for her friend.

That brought Kat’s own blood immediately back to a boil, her anger once again fueling brashness.

“Let her then! I’m sick of that bitchy cheerleader thinking she can run the school just because she’s prettier than everyone else. That’s all she has, and she might not even have that for long,” Kat said cryptically. “If she thinks that gives her the right to say those awful things to you, then I’m going to fight back. I don’t care what she does to me.”

Jess watched her friend’s impassioned diatribe with awe, but when Kat finished, Jess still looked unsure.

“You say that now…” she whispered to Kat.

As her burst of anger once again diminished, Kat gazed at Jess’ concerned expression with a growing sense of dread.

***

Kat had gym sixth period, the class she had been avoiding in her thoughts all day. The reason? It was the only class she shared with Angelica.

Kat braced herself as she watched Angelica enter the locker room, preparing for the worst. The buxom girl, however, never so much as glanced at her, walking by without even acknowledging her presence with a sneer.

Kat kept sneaking glances at Angelica as their gym teacher instructed them on the basics of volleyball and had them begin to play. Angelica ignored her. For the entire class. Not a look. Not a word. It made Kat far more uncomfortable than if the head cheerleader had simply given her the tongue-lashing she had expected. What was Angelica up to?

It didn’t take much longer to find out.

After class, Kat showered, then went back to her locker to change. Her clothes weren’t there. Okay, so it was the ol’ hide the girl’s clothes trick? She wrapped her towel around her and began to search each locker as the room gradually emptied, the other girls heading home for the day.

She heard the flush of a toilet and glanced toward the stalls. Angelica strode out of one of them, giving her an evil smile before strolling out of the locker room, humming one of the insipid chants she had devised for the cheer team as she went.

Kat’s stomach dropped. Okay, so Angelica had taken the steal-the-clothes trip up a notch.

She went to the stall and found her clothes swirling in nastiness. Angelica had even thrown her jacket and sweaty gym clothes in. This could be a bit of a problem. She wasn’t about to fish her clothes out of that!

Here she was, in the middle of winter, with nothing but a towel to wear.

Kat frowned. Well, she had said that she was ready for Angelica’s worst. Nothing like putting that to the test right away! She considered for a moment, then pulled her phone from her backpack. At least Angelica had left that!

Kat called her mom, telling her simply that she had lost her clothes. It wasn’t untrue--those clothes were definitely lost to her now. It was preferable to explaining the Angelica situation to her mother. That would result in calls to the school and the complete loss of status that would come from involving parents and school officials in her little feud. No, she needed to abide by her peers’ unwritten rules of social war. Involving parents would be the equivalent of a social war crime. She needed to handle this on her own.

While she waited for her mom to arrive, she loosened the towel and set it on a bench. She examined herself in the mirror of the empty room.

After another day of growth, she was looking better than ever. Her lush mane seemed to glow with vibrant health as her eyes traveled its length to the small of her back. Its rich, sanguine color flickered and glimmered as it swayed with her movements.

Her face looked a bit more refined and was beginning to border on pretty.

“Pretty,” she said, noticing, now that she was really paying attention, the ever more melodic lilt of her voice. She also savored the word itself. It was a word she never thought she could use to describe herself. Yet, as her eyes took in her larger breasts, closing in on a B-cup now; her still-slender, if a bit soft, waist; her increasingly shapely backside; and her longer, more curvaceous legs, the word suited her.

The ding of the text message on her phone broke her reverie, and she checked it. Her mom was there. Kat again wrapped herself in the towel, scrambling to put on her shoes and backpack before running out to the waiting car. Her mom sat inside, a less-than-pleased look pursing her lips.

When she made it back to her room, she immediately walked to the book on her desk, knowing that her best revenge was to unseat Angelica from her perch at the top of the school’s beauty scale. She flipped to a story she had not yet read.

Tralina’s Tiny, Toned Tummy

Tiny Tralina traveled the terrible track, trying to trace her target, a team of torch-toting tutors. They had taken the talent of taste from the teen’s tongue, and Tralina toured the territory, tasked to take ten tutors to trial for their terrible transgression. Tralina turned, taking time to...

She glanced toward the mirror, a look of satisfaction on her face, knowing that her reflection the next morning would bring her one step closer to taking down her rival.

12112313212.content:
Kat began her morning with her now standard full body inspection with twirl-for-effect. Hair healthier, check. Height higher, check. Breasts bouncier, butt bigger, check check. Beauty blossoming, legs lengthening and tummy toning, check check check. The fact that some of her clothes now felt tighter, particularly in the chest, only added to the developing girl's delight. Kat was a full B-cup now and the perky mounds swiftly introducing themselves to the world would soon require actual bras. That was a rite of passage she had never undergone and where once she would have dreaded the need to spend any more time than absolutely necessary shopping with her Mom, Kat now thought such an outing might involve slightly less harsh criticism and slightly more mother-daughter bonding.

"Of course we can go shopping for bras," her Mom replied with a sweet little smile that stopped Kat in her tracks for a moment. She hadn't seen her mother make such a genuine expression of affection since she was a little girl. It seemed like her Mom had been waiting for a day like this to arrive, as though one of the joys of having a daughter was watching her grow into a woman. Kat had never developed anything like an adult figure and so her Mom had been denied the pleasure of milestones like taking her daughter shopping for her first bra. Until now. After a moment Kat smiled back and hoped this might be the start of a better relationship with her Mom.
"While we're at it we can do something about your wardrobe. You have far too many jeans and t-shirts and not nearly enough blouses, skirts and dresses. You're growing at last and I'm going to make sure you become not just a woman but a lady if it's the last thing I do!" There it was, the old fire was back, but somehow it was warmer. Her Mom was so enthusiastic about doing the best she could for her daughter that Kat couldn't bring herself to oppose it. Besides, she reasoned, if she kept getting taller and leggier then skirts and dresses would be much more forgiving. She'd have to buy a new pair of jeans every time she grew another inch otherwise.

The prospect of having wardrobe trouble because she was growing taller and bustier put a smile on Kat's face and a spring in her step which lasted the entire way to school. In fact, she was still humming a merry tune and practically skipping through the halls on the way to her locker when a long arm shot out of the doorway she'd just passed and a strong hand grasped the back of her collar. Kat's forward motion was suddenly arrested from the top, sending her legs flying out from under her and then swinging back until she hung, dangling by the neck of her shirt, in the iron grip of Herr Kaufmann the music teacher.
"Do zat again," he barked in his thick German accent. This was a problem for Kat since she couldn't tell if he was being serious or sarcastic. Did he actually want her to do whatever it was again or was he metaphorically daring her to continue her alleged rule-breaking to see what her punishment would be?
"Umm, do vot? Oh! I mean do what?" She corrected quickly, copying his pronunciation accidentally. He didn't seem to even notice.
"Ze singing girl, ze pure vocalisation I haf just heard. More! Schnell!"
"Uh... sure. Uh... can you, um... put me down though?" She gasped out after a moment. Hanging by her shirt meant most of her body weight was held up by fabric bunched right around her throat. Kat didn't weigh much but it was still not the position most conducive to singing.
"Vot?" Herr Kaufmann bent his arm and swung her dangling form around to face him, then seemed to realise her predicament and lowered her to the ground where he loomed over her from his 6'4" height. "Ja, of course," he mumbled in something that almost resembled an apology.
"Thank you. Um, you want me to sing?" she asked quietly, still a bit bewildered by the entire encounter.
"Ja. I heard only a little but it vos the clearest tone I haf heard in years. I must know if you haf ze gift!" He glowered at her from under bushy grey eyebrows in grumpy expectation. Embarrassed and more than a little scared, Kat hummed a few bars from a pop song that had been playing on the bus earlier.
"Yessss!" Herr Kaufmann exulted. The light flashed off his round spectacles and the fist that no longer held Kat was clenched before him in victory like an evil mastermind whose scheme had come to fruition. "It is raw, untrained, but such clarity, such potential!" He hardly seemed to be speaking to her at all anymore. "Ze plans must be redrafted, ze positions reassigned. Zere is so much to be done!" Seeming to remember she was still present, the towering music teacher looked down at Kat again. "Be here after school. Do not be late! You are in ze choir now." So saying, he turned on his heel and stalked back into the music room, the door closing with a sharp click behind him.

It hadn't been a question or an offer, it was a statement of fact. Apparently Kat didn't get a say in whether or not she joined the choir, it had been decided. That was Herr Kaufmann's other role, she remembered. He taught music but he was also the school's choir director. Kat had sometimes wondered why the choir never lacked members despite its director's famously strict requirements and difficult temperament. Now she had some insight into his method of recruitment. Whether deliberately or not, Herr Kaufmann seemed to be using his intimidating manner for the benefit of the choir program. Talented singers were not too scared to join the choir, they were probably conscripted and were then too scared to leave.

Now Kat was one of them whether she liked it or not. She could only hope that choir practice didn't clash with ballet or her Mom would burst a vein trying to decide which elegant pastime was more ladylike and should be pursued at the expense of the other. For now though, Kat had a full day ahead of her and there was still an angry queen bitch to deal with.

121123132121.content:
At the end of her final period, Kat approached the choir room for the rehearsal that Herr Kaufmann had made clear was mandatory. She supposed that she could have shirked the responsibility and slipped away after gym class, …but she didn’t really want to. She was looking forward to her first bra fitting almost as much as her mother seemed to be, but there would still be time for that after rehearsing with the choir.

In truth, Herr Kaufmann’s comments about the quality of her voice had intrigued her. She knew that she owed her increasingly mellifluous voice to The Burgeoning Book, and she also knew that the improvements were likely to continue. She smiled. If he thought her voice was good now, just wait…

As Kat’s imagination ran wild with fantasies of taking Broadway by storm with her amazing voice, graceful dancer’s legs, and model-level beauty, she pulled open the heavy door to the choir room.

Herr Kaufmann’s bushy eyebrows were bouncing up and down over the rims of his glasses as he ranted to the students about the need to take choir much more seriously.

“Musik ist serious business, no matter vot you all zink! Bah!” he said in exasperation as he turned from the group, mumbling under his breath. “...faule Schüler, die nie üben…”

As the door clicked shut behind Kat, Herr Kaufmann’s eyes snapped, predator-quick to her tense, wide-eyed visage. He paused, his expression softening, gray mustache twitching.

“Ahh, Kat! Zank you for joining us, ja? Hier, hier…” he picked up a booklet of sheet music and carried it over to the reticent girl. As he handed her the music, he put a large hand in the middle of her back and pushed her lightly toward the rest of the group.

Kat stumbled forward, not sure whether this had been such a good idea after all. Her eyes scanned the students in the group until they found Jess’. Jess’ questioning look made Kat feel a bit guilty. She hadn’t had a chance to tell Jess about her encounter with Herr Kaufmann this morning, but she could have at least sent a text.

Herr Kaufmann seemed to sense Kat’s reluctance, and he increased the pressure on her back a bit. Kat staggered forward again on stiff, resistant legs. She inhaled then let out the breath slowly, steeling her resolve. Okay, she was going to do this! Feelings of determination settling in, Kat’s shoulders relaxed and she walked the rest of the way voluntarily, coming to a stop next to her petite friend.

As Kat looked up, she thought she saw the hint of a smile under Herr Kaufman’s bristly mustache. She quickly discarded the thought. Everyone knew that the man was incapable of smiling. Kat looked down at the stapled booklet in her hand.

Die Zauberflöte. Mozart & Schikaneder.

Scrawled in messy handwriting and highlighted on her copy was a name--at least she thought it was a name. Pamina.

What was this? It wasn’t even in English! She shot Jess a pleading glance. Her friend moved her lips to Kat’s ear and whispered.

“It’s an opera in German that Herr Kaufmann wants us to perform next month.”

An opera? Kat had never even been to the opera. She didn’t know anything about operas. She wondered again what she had gotten herself into. She whispered back to Jess.

“Okay… so what does “Pamina” mean?

Jess gaped, then took Kat’s music to examine it. She opened it, seeing certain sections of arias highlighted, then slapped it shut. She said nothing, simply staring at the handwritten scribble on the cover.

“What? What is it, Jess?” Kat whispered to her friend.

“I think Herr Kaufmann intends for you to play the part of Pamina,” her friend responded slowly.

“Is that good?”

“Um, it’s the female lead, for a soprano. It goes really high too. I hope you’re ready for this, Kat!”

Kat’s felt her stomach drop. This didn’t sound good…

“But Jess, I can’t even read music!”

“It’s okay, I’ll help you. When the notes go higher on these five lines here, move your voice higher. When they go down, go down.”

Okay, that didn’t seem too bad. She could do that.

Herr Kaufmann shuffled some papers on the music stand in front of him, then raised his hands, thumbs and forefingers pinched together. As he swung his arms down, the choir began to sing. Kat simply stood there, agog.

Jess nudged Kat with her tiny elbow. Kat started, then began to sing softly. She started on the wrong note, but within a couple of measures, she seemed to be in tune with the others. She looked up from the paper and noticed that the German choir director was staring right at her, the spark of delight in his steel blue eye. Did that mean he liked what she was doing? Maybe it did! Kat began to sing with more confidence.

Suddenly, however, the rest of the singers stopped, and she was the only one left singing. She continued on. Her voice did sound pretty good, she thought. After a moment, though, the piano accompaniment changed, and the notes began to go really high. She panicked, not sure how this part was supposed to go.

Kat stopped, the instrumental accompaniment continuing for a few more bars until it, too, came to a stop.

“Vat’s vrong?” asked Herr Kaufmann, frowning.

“I, um, can’t really read music,” said Kat.

“Ah…” said the German giant, tapping his foot, his finger rubbing his chin. “Vell, ve shall haf to remedy zat, now von’t ve?”

“Morgen komm… uh... in ze morning before class tomorrow, come to mein office und I shall instruct you,” he said.

“For now, all of you sing Pamina’s zolos. Drop down an octaf oder zwei if you must. Now, MACH LOS!!!” he cried, his sudden directive causing a tremor to ripple through the students in the choir as the music suddenly resumed.

Kat made it through the rest of rehearsal until she finally departed with Jess under the stern, steady, wire-rimmed gaze of Herr Kaufman, his dense mustache framing pursed lips.

1211231321211.content:
Kat arrived home to find a stern look on her mother’s face, though Kat thought she also detected a note of disappointment in the older woman’s eyes. Her mother tapped her watch.

“What took you so long, Kat? Don’t you remember? We talked about this. I’m taking you for a bra fitting this evening!”

“I’m so sorry, mom. See, the choir director came to me this morning and kinda strong-armed me into being in the choir. He wants me to be the lead in this opera that they’re doing, and...” Kat trailed off as she watched her mother’s expression change. Her mature eyebrows shifted from a furrow to a suprised arch; her lips, from a frown to a slowly blossoming smile.

“The lead? In the choir?” The woman clapped her hands together and bounced on the balls of her feet, her delight evident.

“Why didn’t you say so, dear? My daughter… the lead in an opera…” Kat’s mother seemed to be testing the never before spoken phrases on her tongue. Judging by her widening smile—now Cheshire sized—she must have liked their flavor. Her eyes sparkled with eager energy like a Kardashian in front of a camera.

Kat’s shoulders slumped in relief. This news seemed to be going over rather well. Kat supposed she shouldn’t be entirely surprised. Her mother was the driving force behind her ballet lessons, as much as Kat hated them. She typically liked any activities that were geared toward developing her daughter into an elegant and refined lady. Kat knew that her mother’s intentions were noble. She simply wanted the best for her daughter. That was her notion of “best.”

It was just that sometimes Kat didn’t feel the desire to be an elegant, refined lady. Sometimes, she just wanted to simply relax, be herself, to do her own thing. Still, her developing body and improving voice seemed tailor made for the choir/ballet activity combination that her mom so clearly desired for her. If she were really good at them both—good enough to make Vanessa, Angelica, and others of their ilk respect her—maybe it wouldn’t be so bad. Maybe it would even be a chance to get even with those other girls, to beat them at their own games.

Kat’s mom opened the front door, motioning for Kat to go through. As Kat walked out to the car, she felt an arm come around her, then a kiss atop her head.

“I know I don’t say it enough, but I’m proud of you, dear.”
